dialogues.Meredith:
[1]What's your secret? 
[2]No, it's just - you are American, aren't you? - no, I just, I have so much luggage, and you're so, uh, streamlined. It's humiliating. 
[3]I'm Meredith, by the way. Meredith Randall. 
[4]Hello. 
[5]You're not the Shipping Greenleaf's? 
[6]So now, did they put your suitcase in the wrong pile? It's just - upstairs - weren't you under the R stand? I thought I saw you there. 
[7]Which is? 
[8]The funny thing is, I'm not Randall either. I'm Logue. 
[9]As in the Textile Logues. Trying to shrug off the dress. I travel under my mother's name, too. 
[10]Right. 
[11]  
[12] 
[13]But you're going skiing with us Yankees, aren't you? 
[14]At Christmas. To Cortina with Freddie Miles and - 
[15]Everybody knows Freddie Miles. 
[16]Now? I don't think so. But I've met him, of course, and we've chatted and I know about you and Marge and Mongi and what an unreliable rat you are. Freddie said you were a rat and I thought to myself now I know why he travels under R. 
[17]Sorry, I wouldn't have made a joke if - 
[18]The truth is if you've had money your entire life, even if you despise it, which we do - agreed? - you're only truly comfortable around other people who have it and despise it. 
[19]I've never admitted that to anyone. 
[20]Show me the other one again. I like them both. 
[21]I know you're a jazz fiend but do you absolutely hate the Opera?  I've been trying to give my tickets away, it's tomorrow, but if you were prepared to be dragged... 
[22]I thought you were enjoying yourself? 
[23]You're crazy! It's freezing out there. 
[24] 
[25]Don't worry. Really. Don't worry. 
[26]No, I absolutely understand. Of course. 
[27]Beating you away. 
[28]  
[29]Will you meet me tomorrow?  Just to say goodbye in the daylight, properly? So it's not just this, it's too...you should always save pain for daylight... 
[30] 
[31]Peter? Hello, it's Meredith Logue. 
[32]I won't actually, although I think this might - are you waiting for Dickie? 
[33]You were at the Opera? Well, that explains - yes I was there. I was there with Dickie. 
[34] 
[35]He told me everything. I was supposed to meet him fifteen minutes ago, so I...I'm going to go now, I think. Unless he meant us to meet - which would be a little cruel, wouldn't it? 
[36]Ripley? No. I heard about him, of course, but no, I didn't meet him. 
[37]Not for me. No, grazie. 
[38]I hope I didn't complicate matters, but nothing, nothing untoward happened, nothing to prevent you from welcoming him back, from marrying him...Goodbye. Goodbye Peter, please don't get up. 
[39]Dickie?  Dickie? 
[40]Dickie, my God! 
[41]I was looking at you, your clothes, I wouldn't have known you... 
[42]What? 
[43]Hardly. I couldn't be less alone. 
[44]And co. A lot of co. Oh, God, I've thought about you so much. 
[45]When I thought about you I was mostly hating you. Where've you been hiding? 
[46]You're kidding. 
[47]You know, the whole world thinks you killed Freddie? It's terrible. 
[48]So - are you travelling under R? 
[49]Dickie, are you with Peter Smith- Kingsley?  I bet you are. My aunt thought she saw him.
